department.dept_long_name: Department of Chemistry and Chemical Biology

course.title: Applied Quantum Mechanics
course.description: The course will cover the application of quantum mechanical principles to contemporary problems in chemistry and physics. The topics covered in the course will include: chemical bonding and the Born-Oppenheimer Approximation, atom/molecule-photon interaction (including second quantization and the dressed-state approach), Quantum Optics, and solid-state and nano-science (band theory, Fermi liquid theory, and electron transport).
course.prerequisites: Two semesters of quantum mechanics (Chemistry 160 / Chemistry 242, or Physics 143a / 143b, or equivalent).
course.notes: Intended for graduate and advanced undergraduate students in chemistry, physics, and applied physics.
